Question.Subject: Gmail Stops Working on Firefox and Safari?
Question.Content:
I never encountered this problem before until today. I open Gmail on my phone, and it works perfectly..however, when I opened it on Safari and Firefox, the color wheel starts spinning on my MacBook Pro with Mac OS X Ver. 10.5.8..and I had to force quit the applications. My other websites on these two browsers all work perfectly fine. Someone know how to solve this? Let me know ASAP please! It gets kind of annoying after awhile. I'm a college student and I need access to my email! I've attached the error report!
Here's the report:
Date/Time: 2010-03-29 19:05:36 -0700 OS Version: 10.5.8 (Build 9L31a) Architecture: i386 Report Version: 4
Command: Safari Path: /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/MacOS/Safari Version: 4.0.4 (5531.21.10) Build Version: 1 Project Name: WebBrowser Source Version: 55312110 Parent: launchd [75]
PID: 4002 Event: hang Time: 8.47s Steps: 58
Process: Safari [4002] Path: /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/MacOS/Safari
ADDRESS BINARY 00001000 /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/MacOS/Safari 002d8000 /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/SyndicationUI.framework/Versions/A/SyndicationUI 119c6000 /System/Library/CoreServices/RawCamera.bundle/Contents/MacOS/RawCamera 14e93000 /System/Library/Frameworks/OpenGL.framework/Versions/A/Resources/GLRendererFloat.bundle/GLRendererFloat 14f6e000 /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/A/Resources/JavaPluginCocoa.bundle/Contents/MacOS/JavaPluginCocoa 14fd6000 /System/Library/Frameworks/ApplicationServices.framework/Versions/A/Frameworks/CoreGraphics.framework/Versions/A/Resources/libCGXCoreImage.A.dylib 167d7000 /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/A/JavaVM 18f9a000 /System/Library/Frameworks/CoreAudioKit.framework/Versions/A/CoreAudioKit 1915c000 /System/Library/CoreServices/Encodings/libTraditionalChineseConverter.dylib 195e1000 /usr/lib/liblangid.dylib 1960f000 /Library/Internet Plug-Ins/Flash Player.plugin/Contents/MacOS/Flash Player 1b3e9000 /System/Library/CoreServices/Encodings/libSimplifiedChineseConverter.dylib 1b4ee000 /System/Library/Frameworks/ApplicationServices.framework/Versions/A/Frameworks/ATS.framework/Versions/A/Resources/ATSHI.dylib 1b7f0000 /Library/Internet Plug-Ins/googletalkbrowserplugin.plugin/Contents/MacOS/googletalkbrowserplugin 1dcc1000 /usr/lib/libmecab.1.0.0.dylib 212ba000 /System/Library/Frameworks/OpenGL.framework/Resources/GLEngine.bundle/GLEngine 24800000 /System/Library/Extensions/GeForce8xxxGLDriver.bundle/Contents/MacOS/GeForce8xxxGLDriver ba900000 /System/Library/CoreServices/Encodings/libJapaneseConverter.dylib bab00000 /System/Library/CoreServices/Encodings/libKoreanConverter.dylib
Thread id: 90262e8 User stack: 58 ??? [0x29d2] 58 _NSApplicationMain + 574 (in AppKit) [0x917601d8] 58 -[NSApplication run] + 795 (in AppKit) [0x91792f9f] 58 ??? [0xc045] 58 -[NSApplication nextEventMatchingMask:untilDate:inMode:dequeue:] + 128 (in AppKit) [0x91799f88] 58 __DPSNextEvent + 657 (in AppKit) [0x9179a6d5] 58 _BlockUntilNextEventMatchingListInMode + 106 (in HIToolbox) [0x92746f39] 58 _ReceiveNextEventCommon + 374 (in HIToolbox) [0x927470c5] 58 _RunCurrentEventLoopInMode + 283 (in HIToolbox) [0x927472ac] 58 _CFRunLoopRunInMode + 88 (in CoreFoundation) [0x947ceaa8] 58 _CFRunLoopRunSpecific + 3141 (in CoreFoundation) [0x947ce3c5] 58 __ZN17MultiplexerSource7performEv + 189 (in CFNetwork) [0x9571ad03] 58 __ZN19URLConnectionClient13processEventsEv + 104 (in CFNetwork) [0x9576d370] 58 __ZN19URLConnectionClient26ClientConnectionEventQueue33processAllEventsAndConsumePayloadEP20XConnectionEventInfoI12XClientEvent18XClientEventParamsEl + 264 (in CFNetwork) [0x9576e8cc] 58 __ZN19URLConnectionClient21_clientDidReceiveDataEPK8__CFDataPNS_26ClientConnectionEventQueueE + 248 (in CFNetwork) [0x9576d978] 58 __NSURLConnectionDidReceiveData + 177 (in Foundation) [0x90459e11] 58 -[NSURLConnection(NSURLConnectionReallyInternal) sendDidReceiveData:originalLength:] + 119 (in Foundation) [0x90459ec7] 58 __ZN7WebCore14ResourceLoader14didReceiveDataEPNS_14ResourceHandleEPKcii + 56 (in WebCore) [0x90ce3f08] 58 __ZN7WebCore26NetscapePlugInStreamLoader14didReceiveDataEPKcixb + 79 (in WebCore) [0x90ed578f] 58 __ZN23WebNetsc
Question.ChosenAnswer:
There are a few things that should work first clear your cache here is a site that makes it simple: http://support.verio.com/documents/view_article.cfm?doc_id=4069
Here is the same for Firefox: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OukBlXfOP8Y
Finally run "Disk Utilities" as this will clear out the errors that you had going on there as well. You can find it in your "Applications Folder" the go to the "Utilities Folder" it resides there.
Scroll down to the middle of the following link and it'll show you how to run Disk Utilities" http://kb.wisc.edu/helpdesk/page.php?id=3810

Answer.Content:
There are a few things that should work first clear your cache here is a site that makes it simple: http://support.verio.com/documents/view_article.cfm?doc_id=4069
Here is the same for Firefox: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OukBlXfOP8Y
Finally run "Disk Utilities" as this will clear out the errors that you had going on there as well. You can find it in your "Applications Folder" the go to the "Utilities Folder" it resides there.
Scroll down to the middle of the following link and it'll show you how to run Disk Utilities" http://kb.wisc.edu/helpdesk/page.php?id=3810
